{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.06061v1", "title": "Non-reciprocal waves in two-dimensional electron systems with
  temperature gradient", "summary": "We demonstrate that the interaction of dc temperature gradient with ac
magnetic field in temperature-biased two-dimensional electron systems leads to
formation of a new electromagnetic mode, a two-dimensional thermomagnetic wave
(2d TMW). This wave is transverse electric and non-reciprocal, and its damping
rate can be lower than that of conventional 2d plasma waves. The Q-factor of 2d
TMW is independent of the wave vector. Numerical estimates show that in
state-of-the-art two-dimensional electrons systems the 2d TMW Q-factor is the
order of $10^{-3}$. We discuss possible ways to overcome this issue.", "main_category": "cond-mat.mes-hall", "categories": "cond-mat.mes-hall", "published": "2025-04-08T14:07:15Z"}
